nodes.excerpt: Turn your notes about any particular topic to podcasts automatically. Listen to them over and over again for convenience and to retain the information better. Share your knowledge with the world with a click of a button. Check out https://www.note-bytes.com/
nodes.title: NoteBytes - Turn your notes into podcasts and share them with the world
nodes.author: Irtiza Hafiz

nodes.excerpt: A Python package to copy all your Kindle highlights and notes to a database in Notion. Plug in your Kindle device to your PC to run this script. Requires Python 3.9+ installed on your system.
nodes.title: Kindle2Notion - Export your Kindle clippings to a Notion database
nodes.author: Jeffrey Jacob

nodes.excerpt: Cryptgeon is a fast, secure, open source self-destructing note sharing service. Inspired by PrivNote, Powered by rust & svelte.
nodes.title: Cryptgeon - Securely share self-destructing notes
nodes.author: Bharadwaj Giridhar

nodes.excerpt: Notea is a Self hosted Note taking app stored on S3, that you can deploy with one click to Vercel, AWS, or deploy with Docker ğŸ³. It supports storage in Amazon S3, MinIO, Aliyun OSS and others. It's powered by TypeScript ğŸš€ and loves Mark Down.
nodes.title: Notea - Free self-hosted open source note taking app, like Notion

nodes.excerpt: Wikipedia, Blinkist and Anki go into a bar. They get drunk, they get down and whups - there it is. On knugget you can discover knowledge nuggets and keep them in mind with the help of spaced repetition.
nodes.title: knugget - community-based Blinkist with build-in spaced repetition
nodes.author: Johannes Benjamin

nodes.excerpt: UpNote is an elegant and powerful note-taking app that works across Android, Mac, Windows and iOS. Designed to make it easy to take notes and stay focused, UpNote combines a beautiful interface with a fluid workflow for a refined note-taking experience.
nodes.title: UpNote for Android - Simple, beautiful note-taking app across platforms
nodes.author: Thomas

nodes.excerpt: A stupidly simple and private text tool that I made for personal use to help me think multidimensionally.
nodes.title: Four note boards - A simply stupid text tool to help think multidimensionally
nodes.author: Vineet Kapil

nodes.excerpt: tabExtend helps you manage your tabs. The browser extension replaces your new tab with an overview where you can create groups containing your tabs, notes, and text-snippets. Visually organize it all with ease using drag and drop and handy shortcuts.
nodes.title: tabExtend - Easily save tabs and quickly create notes in your browser
nodes.author: Gabe Ragland

nodes.title: Notion Planners - Plan your day, week and month in Notion

nodes.excerpt: Mochi = Spaced repetition + Zettelkasten + Markdown
nodes.title: Mochi mobile - Take notes in markdown, study them with spaced repetition
nodes.author: Matt Steedman

nodes.excerpt: Track important tasks and projects, create upcoming events, keep notes and control expenses in one notion table. You can quickly find your to-do list or see how much money you spent last week.
nodes.title: Magic Board for Notion - Organize your entire life with one board

nodes.excerpt: Hugo improves meeting productivity for teams. It connects to your work calendar providing one place to collaboratively prepare, take notes, assign tasks and share insights. â € Get on top of remote meetings with notes that connect to your team and their tools.
nodes.title: Hugo - Better meetings through centralized, actionable notes

nodes.title: Slid - Capture knowledge from online videos, courses, and webinars
nodes.author: Bram Kanstein (@bramk)

nodes.excerpt: bilgge is a free service which makes you feel as if you were storing data in a real safe house. instead of saying "it uses end-to-end encryption" then asking you 8+ characters password to protect your data, it gives you power to encrypt your data by yourself in your browser.
nodes.title: bilgge. - a privacy-paranoid free service for your notes and secrets
